skill.name: cluster-management
skill.description: Monitor and manage Proxmox cluster nodes, resources, and infrastructure health. Track node status, cluster quorum, and resource allocation across your virtualization platform.
skill.summary: Monitor Proxmox VE cluster infrastructure, node health, and resource allocation
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation for Proxmox VE cluster management tools. Static analysis detected 40 pattern matches, but all are false positives: weak crypto warnings are misidentified cluster terminology, backticks are markdown formatting, and URL references are legitimate GitHub sources. The skill interacts with Proxmox infrastructure APIs which inherently requires network access and external commands.

low_findings.title: Infrastructure API Access
low_findings.description: This skill interfaces with Proxmox VE cluster management APIs which require network access and command execution. This is expected and legitimate for infrastructure management tools. Users should ensure appropriate authentication and access controls are configured in their Proxmox environment.

content.user_title: Monitor Proxmox Cluster Health and Infrastructure
content.value_statement: Managing Proxmox cluster infrastructure requires constant monitoring of node health, resource allocation, and quorum status. This skill provides comprehensive cluster visibility and health reporting through simple natural language queries.
actual_capabilities: List all nodes in Proxmox cluster with current status
Retrieve detailed node health metrics including CPU, memory, and storage
Query cluster-wide resource utilization and allocation
Monitor cluster quorum status and configuration
Identify resource bottlenecks and capacity issues
limitations: Requires active Proxmox VE cluster with API access configured
Read-only monitoring capabilities, does not modify cluster configuration
Depends on Proxmox MCP server for API connectivity
Cannot perform cluster maintenance or node operations

use_cases.title: Daily Cluster Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Infrastructure administrators can quickly assess cluster status, verify all nodes are online, and identify any performance degradation or capacity issues before they impact workloads.

use_cases.title: Capacity Planning Analysis
use_cases.description: DevOps teams can analyze current resource utilization patterns across the cluster to plan for scaling, identify underutilized nodes, and optimize VM placement strategies.

use_cases.title: Incident Response Investigation
use_cases.description: Site reliability engineers can rapidly gather cluster state information during outages or performance incidents to identify failing nodes, resource exhaustion, or quorum problems.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Cluster Status Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current status of all nodes in the Proxmox cluster
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick health check to verify all cluster nodes are operational

prompt_templates.title: Resource Utilization Report
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current CPU, memory, and storage utilization across all cluster nodes?
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyzing resource consumption patterns for capacity planning

prompt_templates.title: Node Performance Deep Dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Get detailed performance metrics for node pve-01 including running VMs and resource allocation
prompt_templates.scenario: Investigating performance issues on a specific cluster node

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Cluster Health Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete cluster health report including all nodes, quorum status, resource utilization, and recommendations
prompt_templates.scenario: Executive summary for management or documentation purposes

output_examples.input: Show me all nodes in the cluster
output_examples.output:
Your Proxmox cluster has 3 nodes:

1. pve-01 (online) - CPU: 45%, Memory: 62%, Storage: 58%
2. pve-02 (online) - CPU: 38%, Memory: 71%, Storage: 64%
3. pve-03 (online) - CPU: 52%, Memory: 55%, Storage: 49%

Cluster quorum: 3/3 nodes (healthy)
Overall cluster health: Good

output_examples.input: Are there any nodes with capacity issues?
output_examples.output:
Capacity analysis for your cluster:

Node pve-02 has high memory utilization at 71%. Consider:
- Migrating some VMs to pve-03 which has lower utilization
- Adding memory to pve-02 if sustained above 75%

All other nodes have healthy capacity levels. Cluster storage is well balanced.

output_examples.input: What is the cluster quorum status?
output_examples.output:
Cluster quorum status: Healthy

Quorum votes: 3/3 nodes voting
Expected votes: 3
Quorum: Yes (3 votes)

All nodes are participating in quorum. Cluster can tolerate one node failure while maintaining operations.

best_practices: Check cluster health daily and investigate any node status changes immediately
Monitor resource utilization trends to proactively plan capacity expansion before exhaustion
Maintain minimum three-node quorum for high availability and automatic failover
anti_patterns: Ignoring quorum warnings or operating cluster with insufficient nodes for failover
Running nodes at sustained high utilization without capacity planning
Making infrastructure decisions without checking current cluster resource state

faq.question: What Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill works with Proxmox VE 6.0 and later through the Proxmox API. Ensure your MCP server is configured with proper API credentials.

faq.question: Can this skill restart nodes or VMs?
faq.answer: No, this is a monitoring and reporting skill with read-only access. It cannot modify cluster configuration or control nodes.

faq.question: What does quorum status mean?
faq.answer: Quorum is the minimum number of nodes that must agree for cluster operations. With 3 nodes, you need 2 voting for quorum. This prevents split-brain scenarios.

faq.question: How often should I check cluster health?
faq.answer: Daily health checks are recommended. Set up monitoring alerts for critical issues, but use this skill for detailed investigation and capacity planning.

faq.question: What should I do if a node shows as offline?
faq.answer: Investigate network connectivity, check physical hardware, review Proxmox logs on the affected node, and verify cluster network configuration. VMs may need migration.

faq.question: Does this require special Proxmox permissions?
faq.answer: Yes, the API user needs read permissions for cluster resources, nodes, and status information. PVEAuditor role or equivalent is recommended.
